document.description: List of success stories from companies implementing Bing controls and services.

product.header: See how Epicurious uses Speech to enable hands-free use of their app while preparing meals.
product.content: Using integrated speech functionality, the Epicurious app lets users prepare meals without ever touching their phones. The app can read ingredients and step-by-step instructions using Speech Synthesis. Users navigate and control the app with the speech recognition API. Users can even start the app with a voice command, using the Voice Command Definition file (VCD).
The ​Discovery application launches using Voice Command Definition files (VCD). Enhanced navigation supports Speech Synthesis, In-App Speech and Continuous Recognition.

Vimeo now allows voice commands by using a Voice Command Definition file (VCD). Speech recognition APIs allow initiation of voice commands associated with Vimeo content. You can say "Open Vimeo My Videos" to access your Vimeo videos.
The Marketwatch application launches using Voice Command Definition files (VCD), and enables stock look-up with Voice Search APIs, Speech Synthesis, and Continuous Recognition.
The NBC News application launches using Voice Command Definition files (VCD). It enables Headline search through Voice Search APIs, Speech Synthesis, and Continuous Recognition.
Package Tracker provides tracking information about your package for over 60 different carriers. It uses the Bing Maps SDK for Windows Store apps to show the last location of your package on a map.
London Bus Checker provides real-time bus arrival information for London buses. It uses the Bing Maps SDK for Windows Store apps to display bus routes and stops.
FloodAlerts provides real-time flood warning in England and Wales. It uses the Bing Maps SDK for Windows Store apps to display where flooding is occurring and where potential flooding may occur.
